title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 207.27 - Examinations before trial in contested probate proceedings
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22 ยง 207.27 - Examinations before trial in contested probate proceedings

State Regulations

In any contested probate proceeding in which
objections to probate are made and the proponent or the objectant seeks an
examination before trial, the items upon which the examination will be held
shall be determined by the application of article 31 of CPLR. Except upon the
showing of special circumstances, the examination will be confined to a
three-year period prior to the date of the propounded instrument and two years
thereafter, or to the date of decedent's death, whichever is the shorter
period. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 22
ยง
207.27

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
